title: Microlearning Design for Scientific Inquiry and Experimental Data Sharing via Facebook-Based Social Learning Networks

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science knowledge (experimental design, variable control, data measurement), experience with digital learning tools, basic understanding of the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis-experiment-analysis-conclusion)
context.additional_context: A short-term course for strengthening scientific job competencies within enterprises, establishing a collaborative learning environment via Facebook. Emphasizes cultivating problem-solving skills applicable to real-world tasks through case studies of scientific experiments, with a particular focus on systematic analysis of experimental observation data and evidence-based conclusion drawing.

learning_goals: Learners autonomously operate a Facebook-based science discussion group using an extended e-moderation model, discussing the formulation of experimental hypotheses and methods for controlling independent/dependent variables.

Learners achieve over 80% peer feedback participation rates using Facebookâ€™s social features in mobile environments, enhancing their ability to analyze data and draw conclusions based on scientific evidence.

Learners improve collaborative inquiry skills and sharing of experimental observation data in science problem-solving processes through a Facebook-based social learning network, experiencing conclusion-drawing via peer validation.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
